GapFillInput.Title: have to, don’t have to, can and can’t
GapFillInput.Instruction: Write the correct form of have to, don’t have to, can or can’t in the gaps. Type your answers in each gap. Use short forms.

Content.Question:
1. Ian is the doorman at the Ritz Hotel.
He has to wear (wear) a uniform.
He doesn't have to clean (clean) the rooms.
He has to open (open) the hotel doors.
He can't smoke (smoke) at the door.
2. Marta and Eva are receptionists.
They have to wear (wear) smart clothes.
They can't eat food (eat food) at the reception desk.
They have to use (use) a computer.
They don't have to speak (speak) every language.
3. Sara is a chambermaid.
She can't sleep (sleep) on the beds.
She doesn't have to carry (carry) heavy bags.
She has to clean (clean) the rooms.
She can't phone (phone) her friends from the rooms.
